abstract: Residents of Pahoa on Hawaii's Big Island have been living with anxiety over path of slow-moving lava flow that has been inching toward town since June 2014, wondering all the while where lava may ooze next; although there is little risk of death due to lava's slow pace, not even geologists can predict which way lava will flow, with greatest worry being that lava will reach Route 130 highway to nearby town Hilo.
lead_paragraph: Residents of the Hawaiian town of Pahoa have learned to adapt as a slow-moving lava flow menaces their community.

headline.main: No Need to Run in Hawaii: The Lava Is Coming, but Very Slowly
headline.print_headline: No Need to Run in Hawaii: The Lava Is Coming, but Very Slowly

snippet: Residents of the Hawaiian town of Pahoa have learned to adapt as a slow-moving lava flow menaces their community.
